climbs.name: Still Sleeping
climbs.fa: Mike Lhore, Remo or old school

content.description: Stand start with good side-pull holds.  Set feet, and mantle up to reach good edges up high and right.  Top-out.
content.location: On south arete of boulder.  The Sleepy time boulder is downhill from the Flux boulder by about 40ft.  Or where the CCC and Grottos trails split, head strait into the woods keeping the CCC on you right, you will see this boulder at the start of the talus field.

content.description:
Sharing the right arete with the V1 Still Sleeping, this compression problem was uncovered after a tree blocking the left arete was mysteriously removed.

 Differing in character from other climbs on the sleepytime boulder, this problem relies more on power than technical footwork. From a stand, find small feet, squeeze both aretes, and power your way up to the boulder's apex. The good holds, slight overhang, and clean landing make this thing great!
content.location: The slightly overhanging face on the southwest side of the sleepytime slab. Can be found from the south shore trail, or from the flux boulder higher in the talus.

climbs.name: Groggy
climbs.fa: Mike Lohre, Remo or old school

content.description: Thin and balancy start.  Make your way up and a little left to good side-pulls.  Top-out.  Good footwork gets you to the top of this one.
content.location: Middle of slab just to the right of Still Sleeping on the Sleepy Time boulder.  The Flux boulder is about 40ft up hill.

climbs.name: Fully Aroused
climbs.fa: M. Lohre, Remo or old school

content.description: Start on good in-cut edge.  Crank you way up left to dime-edge crimp.  Get your feet set and hit the top.  Technical and fun.
content.location: On slab just right of Groggy on the Sleepy Time boulder.  Flux boulder is just up hill.

content.description:
Tucked in the woods at the east edge of the boulder field.

 Also called the "Naptime Boulder" in Bonamici.
